intro: Donax congensis, commonly known as the dwarf tamarack, is a small evergreen shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the Cupressaceae family, which includes cypress and juniper species. The plant is characterized by its scale-like leaves and small, cone-like fruits. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
